results.title: La Mort En Direct = Death Watch
results.brief_description:
Roddy, a TV cameraman has a camera implanted in his brain and is assigned by a ruthless TV producer to follow the slow agony of a mortally ill woman, Katherine Mortenhoe. His footage will then be run on the popular TV series, ‘Death Watch’. Katherine knows she is condemned by an incurable illness. While the TV station is only interested in ratings and the grim spectacle of what goes on inside the brain of someone who knows she’s doomed, Roddy becomes increasingly compassionate and disgusted by the tawdriness of his assignment as he comes to know Katherine better. Sadly, all the English speaking actors are dubbed in French in this particular version.

Credits: Producers: Elie Kfouri, Bertrand Tavernier ; director, Bertrand Tavernier ; writers, Bertrand Tavernier, David Rayfel ; photography, Pierre-William Glenn ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Romy Schneider, Harvey Keitel, Harry Dean Stanton, Therese Liotard, Max von Sydow, Bernhard Wicki.

results.title: La Mort En Ce Jardin = Death in the Garden
results.creator_credit: Oscar Dancigers, David Mage and Luis Bunuel
results.brief_description:
When anti-military rebellion erupts in a remote Central Americam tin-mining settlement, a group of French people led by Shark, an escaped prisoner, make for Brazil via the river. Forced to abandon their boat, the fugitives trek through the jungle, enduring all manner of hardship and deprivation. This is a straightforward adventure yarn, indeed a poitboiler, but Bunuel’s familiar targets - greed and hypocrisy - are still in evidence.

Credits: Producers, Oscar Dancigers, David Mage ; director, Luis Bunuel ; writers, Raymond Queneau, Gabriel Arout, Luis Alcoriza ; photography, Jorge Stahl Junior ; music, Paul Misraki ; editor, Marguerite Renoir.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Georges Marchal, Michel Piccoli, Michele Girardon, Charles Vanel.

results.title: La Modification = the Modification
results.brief_description:
A husband recalls his past experiences as he travels by train to Rome from Paris. He has just left his wife for his mistress and flashbacks are employed to tell his story. He thinks of his future in Rome with his mistress as he fondly remembers the highpoints of his mariage.

Credits: Producer, Rene Thevenet ; director, Michel Worms ; writers, Michel Worms, Raphael Cluzel ; photography, Daniel Vogel ; music, Francis Lai.
Cast: Emmanuelle Riva, Maurice Ronet, Silva Koscina, Luis Massoli, Bernard Jeantet, Philippe Chauveau [narration].

results.title: La Marseillaise
results.creator_credit: La Compagnie Jean Renoir, Andre Seigneur and Jean Renoir
results.brief_description: Renoir financed “La Marseillaise” entirely from public subscription. The film traces the fortunes of two young men during the French Revolution. Renoir’s characteristic warmth and faith in human nature is prominent, and he concentrates on portraying the lives of ordinary people during the revolutionary period. This is one of the few great films to deal seriously with this momentous time in history.

results.title: La Mama
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: on stage”.
Betty Burstall founded La Mama in Carlton, Melbourne, in 1967 as a venue for experimental theatre. During her nine years as Artistic Director, she encouraged playwrights, poets, actors and musicians to reject theatrical traditions and push the boundaries of performing art. La Mama is synonymous with the renaissance of Australian theatre. Playwrights such as Williamson, Buzo, Dickins, Romeril and Hibberd wrote about contemporary Australia. Actors rejected the formality of conventional theatre and developed a larrikin performance style which reflected a new awareness of cultural identity. In this engaging compilation film, Burstall, her successor Liz Jones, writers Barry Dickins and Jack Hibberd and performers Petter Cummins and Valerie Kirwin speak to Mary-Lou Jelbart about the challenges and joys of working at La Mama.

results.title: La Maison des Bories = the House of the Bories
results.brief_description:
Carl is the young scholar who comes to live with French geologist Julian and his wife Isabelle and two children. Carl is eager to study with the famous geologist, but soon he is involved in a love affair with his mentor’s wife.

Credits: Producer, Philippe Dussart ; director, Jacques Doniol-Valcroze ; writer, Anne Tromelin ; photography, Ghislain Cloquet.
Cast: Marie Dubois, Maurice Garrel, Helene Vallier, Mathieu Cariere, Veronique Maurin.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 7
results.brief_description:
Herve and his new family are back in Paris. Herve’s dad has great difficulty recovering from his war traumas and adjusting to civilian life. This causes enormous tension in the house and the children fear this may lead the family to the brink. When Papa Albert comes for a visit to report Maman Jeanne’s ill-health, Herve runs away from home to return to La Villeneuve.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 6
results.brief_description:
The war is over and Maman Jeanne knows that Marcel will not return. For Herve and the children, the end of the war means leaving the Picards and returning to Paris. Herve’s dad and his new wife Helene come to the house in the woods for a visit. Herve gets to meet Brigitte, his new sister for the first time.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve Levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat, Paul Crauchet, Barbara Laage.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 5
results.brief_description:
Herve accompanies papa Albert in the woods to track a poacher.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve Levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat, Paul Crauchet.

results.title: La Maison des Bois: Episode 4
results.brief_description:
The kids visit Albert at the air field and Herve gets to fly in a plane with the lieutenant. As the groups prepares to leave, a German plane is spotted over the village of La Villeneuve.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Long ; director, Maurice Pialat ; photography, Roger Duculot ; music, Maurice Ravel.
Cast: Pierre Doris, Jacqueline Dufranne, Agathe Natanson, Herve levy, Fernand Gravey, Maurice Pialat.
